> Hey Mattias, this is great work.  The graphical nature of the demos
> really helps us appreciate what the evolution is accomplishing.

The reason I make them so graphical is that I can enjoy them more that 
way - I hope others feel the same way ;)

> I am
> currently traveling, but when I get more time I'll give some more
> comments.  

Sure thing!

> By the way, would you like me to put your source code
> distribution up on our NN group web pages, where all the other NEAT
> source version are currently available?  

Well, the thing is that the code might be in a state of flux, or it 
might be stable rigt now. I'm not sure what the future holds - but if I 
update it a lot, it'd be a hassle keeping it up to date on both sites. 
If it's stable, that would be fine. So perhaps we should give it a month 
and then put up a new version? Or you could put up a similar page for 
DelphiNEAT, but link to the binary release?

> I'll also fix my own web pages that mention software to point to your
> new NEAT page.

Cool!

cheers,
mattias
